description: From Tom + cat, popularised by The Life and Adventures of a Cat (1760), by an anonymous author, in which the male cat was called Tom.

entries.meaning: A tom, an intact male cat.

verbs.description: tomcat (third-person singular simple present tomcats, present participle tomcatting, simple past and past participle tomcatted)

examples: He would not go roaming the streets tom-catting like Mr Schick.
